title: Catalonia parliament elects Quim Torra as new regional leader
text:
May 14, 2018 / 12:46 PM / Updated 11 minutes ago Catalonia parliament elects Quim Torra as new regional leader Reuters Staff 1 Min Read
MADRID (Reuters) - The Catalan parliament elected hard-line separatist Quim Torra as regional leader on Monday, heralding an end to seven months of direct rule from Madrid but also more political uncertainty in a region that retains a mandate to seek a split from Spain. Quim Torra looks on during an investiture debate at the regional parliament in Barcelona, Spain, May 14, 2018. REUTERS/Albert Gea
The deeply-divided parliament voted 66 in favour, 65 against and 4 abstentions for the election of Torra, handpicked by the regionâ€™s exiled former leader Carles Puigdemont. Reporting by Paul Day; Editing by Sonya Dowsett
